6.20.19  9:22 am   Is it true that foods become better when you put a stick through them?

6.20.19  7:17 am   do you like waffles? 

     they're ok but they should have higher resolution

6.20.19  6:07 am   i meant to click the unscramble page and missed, so now im lost can you just unscramble this question?

     i can't do an anagram of this question because i have to answer questions in order, so that would delay the questions process by several hours. i learned my lesson somewhere around 9.30.16  10:11 am. and that's why i created the anagrams page to take a separate stream of requests just for anagrams. if you submit something there it may get done eventually. i post 1 a day. also here's the anagrams page

6.20.19  6:03 am   I have lots of ideas for song lyrics but i dont know how to write music for them, any advice?

     just try singing them in different ways. then choose one, and record it so everyone knows how it goes. then move on. they will get better with each song. for stronger results in the future, i would recommend thinking about the singing as you first come up with the lyrics. lyrics and music are both made stronger when they are written together, performed together, they are stronger together. where as if you do one and then try to add the other, the results can be a bit frankenstein

6.20.19  3:59 am   Some people say one should visualize success for a boost towards achieving it, but my cripping insecurities and or fear of expecttions keeps me from actually visualizing success for fear of being hurt in case of failure. any tips? im towards the end of a big project and i really believe it can be a success but cant picture it because of realistic (perhaps pessimistic) expectations that it might not and it kinda feels dangerous to believe people will love it.

     there's nothing you can really do about this. all i can suggest, to put it in perspective, is try not doing any big projects. then you will be able compare the sadness to the fear and see which one you like better

      others say imagine something you'd be doing once you achieve your dream, and it would be pretty similar to what im doing right now so thats hard too. love the content keep it reasonable

6.19.19  10:40 am   Do you think that there's a possibility that the existence of the entire, infinite universe will disintegrate one day?
Do you think that the concept of existing will cease to exist one day? (by that I mean that there will be nothing left: No humans, plants or animals. No outer space. No atoms. No electrons. No particles. Nothing.)
We will eventually die and go extinct, our planet Earth will eventually get destroyed, the sun will eventually explode and die, so why should the entire universe last forever?
If the universe does die though, will its death last forever? Or will another big bang occur after some time?
If the "nothing lasts forever" concept is true, that could mean that the concept of nothing existing would eventually end, and a concept of something new existing would take its place. Y'know what I mean?
This "nothing lasts forever" thing is making me realise that we are/might be stuck in this constant loop where eve rything is going in out out of existence all the time. The process of it might be slow, but it's there, it's real... or is it?
What are your thoughts on this entire thing?
((((I'm really sorry for bothering you with this!!!))))

     well, you could look at it this way. if something goes in and out of existence ....... then the part that didn't exist didn't exist. only exist part exists. exist for entire time
